page.title: 06ARABLE FARMING
page.content: All farmers in the area grow cereals, potatoes, sugar beet or a combinations of these. Wheat and Barley are mostly grown under contract and sold back to the contractor for animal feeds, seed, malting or milling. A combine harvester harvests the cereal crops: it cuts the corn, threshes it & stores it in a large bin for augering into trailers ready for carting to the farm for storage. The straw is then baled and used for bedding livestock. The maize is grown for animal feed. The sugar beet is grown under contract to the British Sugar Corporation, with the farmer buying back the waste pulp for animal feed. The potatoes are sold by the farmers privately at Â£1.75 per half cwt or bought in bulk by contract.
